content:
ENGLISH 义务教育教科书五年级下册义务教育教科书英语五年级下册 （一年级起点） （一年级起点） 英语全国价格举报电话：12315：4.90元 
[中国] 河北 教育 出版 社 [加拿大] DC加拿大国际交流中心合作编写 ENGLISH 义务教育教科书英语 （一年级起点） 五年级下册亲爱的同学们，新学期开始了！ 这学期你们将和李明一起体验加拿大的日常生活，并学习有关运动和健康生活方式等方面的知识。 你们想知道加拿大的学校和我们的学校有什么不同吗？ 你们想知道如何搭配营养、合理饮食吗？ 你们想知道每天需要锻炼多长时间才能保持身体健康吗？那就开始我们这学期的学习吧！ 同学们， 这学期你们将继续学习人称代词和一般过去时等知识， 在学习中， 你们要注意发现语言规律并积极主动地运用这些规律。 请你们多参与英语学习活动，经常与老师和同学交流学习体会，探索适合自己的学习方法。相信你们一定能学得更好！ 致同 学 
CONTENTS Unit 1 Li Ming Goes to Canada ······1 Unit 2 School in Canada ············17 Unit 3 We Love Sports ················33 Unit 4 Good Habits ·····················49 Word List ·········································65 Vocabulary ······································68 1 UNIT 1 Lessons 1~6 Li Ming Goes to Canada

content: 1 UNIT 1 Lessons 1~6 Li Ming Goes to Canada 2 1 Li Ming arrives today B 2 There’s Li Ming! Lesson 1 At the Airport Li Ming is coming to Canada as a visiting student. He arrives today. Today is September 1. He will go home on June 25. Look at the clock. It’s half past four. Yes. Li Ming’s plane will arrive at 5 o’clock. What time is it now ? It’s 4:45. Please sit down. What time is it now ? It’s 5:15. But I can’t see him. I see him! There he is! 1 2 3 4 3 2. Read and draw. It’s fi ve ten. It’s half past four. It’s ten twenty-fi ve. It’s seven forty. Nice to see you! Nice to see you, too! Did you have a good trip ? Let’s go home. Hi Li Ming! 5 6 1. Read. Tick or cross. Li Ming is coming to Canada. Today is October 1. Li Ming will stay in Canada for one year. Li Ming will arrive tomorrow. Are they true ? Let’s read the sentences. 3 Let’s do it! Yes, thank you.

content: 4 1 Rooms in Jenny’s house Lesson 2 Jenny’s House Here’s my house, Li Ming! Come in! I’ll show you around. There is a living room, a kitchen and a bathroom on the fi rst fl oor. This is the living room. This is the kitchen. There are four bedrooms and a study on the second fl oor. This is the study. This is my bedroom. That is your bedroom! Thanks! 1 3 5 2 4 6 Here’s the bathroom. There is a toilet. 5 2. Draw, write and talk. There are six rooms in my house. There is a… 2 Let’s do it! 1. Look and write. f. My sister listens to music in her ____________. a. Our family lives in this _____________________. c. I do my homework in the __________________. d. I wash my face in the ______________________. e. My mom cooks dinner in the _______________. b. We watch TV in the _______________________.

content: 6 Mrs. Smith: Good morning, Li Ming and Jenny. Li Ming: Good morning, Mrs. Smith. What time is it? Mrs. Smith: It’s half past seven. Time for breakfast! What would you like for breakfast, Li Ming? Li Ming: I’d like some eggs, bread and juice, please. Mrs. Smith: What would you like for breakfast, Jenny? Jenny: I’d like some milk and bread, please. 1 It’s time for breakfast! Lesson 3 Making Breakfast Mom is cooking eggs in the kitchen. This is the fridge. The j uice is in the fridge. Here are some dishes. Let’s put them on the table. Breakfast is ready! Let’s eat! Okay. Thank you. 1 3 2 4

content: 7 1. Talk, write and draw. 2. Read. Tick or cross. bread eggs milk Me What would you like for breakfast ? I’d like some bread, eggs and milk. 2 Let’s do it! Chinese food is different from Western food in many ways. One big difference is that Chinese food often has more vegetables, while Western food has much more meat. Chinese people like to eat cooked vegetables but people in the West often don’t. Chinese people like hot water but Western people often drink ice water. Chinese people like to drink tea but Western people like coffee. Chinese people use chopsticks and Western people use knives and forks. Chinese food and Western food are different in many ways. There are more vegetables in Western food. Chinese people like to eat cooked vegetables. Western people often drink ice water. Chinese people like to use knives and forks.

content: 8 1 Time for dinner! Lesson 4 Making Dinner Li Ming: What time is it? Jenny: It’s half past six. Time for dinner! I’m hungry, Mom! What’s for dinner? Mrs. Smith: I’m cooking meat and vegetables. Jenny: Let’s help my mother make dinner. She needs some vegetables. Li Ming: Okay. I can wash the vegetables. The potatoes and carrots are on the table. 2 Let’s wash the dishes! Dinner’s ready! This is delicious, Mrs. Smith. May I help you, Mr. Smith ? Great! Sure, Li Ming! I’m washing the dirty dishes. You can dry the dishes. The tomatoes are in the fridge. 1 1 2 2 Now the dishes are clean and dry!

content: 9 Read, match and write. Mrs. Smith is in the kitchen. She is going to ________ dinner. Her hands are ________. She is ________ing her hands. She is ________ing eggs in the kitchen. They are having dinner. The dishes are ________. Mr. Smith is ________ing the dishes. Li Ming is drying the dishes. The dishes are ________ now. 5 1 4 7 2 5 8 3 6 9 3 Let’s do it! 10 1 Lesson 5 In the Living Room In the living room Jenny and Danny are watching TV. Jenny is sitting in a chair and Danny is sitting beside her. Can you fi nd Lynn and Bob in this picture? Lynn is Jenny’s sister and Bob is Jenny’s brother. They are playing cards. They are happy. What are Mr. and Mrs. Smith doing? They are reading the newspaper. Do you see me at the table? I am writing a letter. It’s Saturday. We are in the living room. Look at us. What are we doing ?

content: 12 I make a house with the dishes. My mother says, “Baby Becky, don’t play with the dishes!” “Mine!” I say. “No! Play with your toys,” says my mother. I don’t want my toys. I want the dishes. “Mine!” I say. I like to cook eggs. My mother says, “Baby Becky! Don’t play with the eggs!” “Mine!” I say. “No!” says my mother. Oh no! Lesson 6 Baby Becky at Home I like to cook. I open the fridge. I see tomatoes, eggs and milk. Oh no! Look out, Baby Becky! 1 2 3 4 Story time My name is Baby Becky. I say “goo”. I say “blub”. I say “waaaaa”. I say “mine”. I like to help my mother. After lunch, my mother washes the dishes. I dry the dishes.

content: 13 I am tired of sitting in the water. I want a shower. Now I am clean. There’s water everywhere in the bathroom. My mother says, “Baby Becky! You are dirty!” We go to the bathroom. I put my toy in the toilet. “No, Baby Becky! No! No! Don’t play in the toilet.” “Mine!” I say. “Oh no!” says my mother. We go to the kitchen. “Mine!” I say. “Yes,” says my mother. “It’s yours now.” My mother is in the living room. She is tired. “What time is it?” she says. “Oh no! It’s six o’clock! Time to make dinner!” No, Baby Becky! 5 6 7 8 What does Baby Becky do at home? Does she help her mother? Think About It mine 我的（东西） look out 小心 shower 淋浴，沐浴 14 1 2 Look and write Listen. Tick or cross. Unit 1 Review 1. She likes __________ and bread for breakfast. 2. We need some __________ and carrots. 3. __________ are good for us. 4. Mrs. Smith is cooking eggs in the __________. 5. Where are the __________? They are in the fridge. 5 4 3 2 1 1 2 3 4

content: 15 Jane’s grandmother 4 3 Read and talk Read and write Jane’s grandfather is watching TV in the living room. Her sister is there, too. Jane’s grandmother is reading the newspaper in the bedroom. Jane’s mother is washing the dishes in the kitchen. Jane’s brother, Jack, is singing in the bathroom. Where is Jane? She is doing her homework in the study. 1. The flowers are very beautiful. I like __________ very much. 2. Hi Danny. I can’t find my ruler. Can you help __________ ? 3. Mom, we are thirsty. Please give __________ some water. 4. Bob is my friend. I will invite __________ to my birthday party. 5. Mary is in the U.S. I want to send __________ a postcard. 6. — Hi Jack! May I play with __________ ? — Sure. Let’s go to the park. him you her them us me Jane’s grandfather Jane’s mother Jane Jane’s sister Jack Where are they ? What are they doing ?

content: 17 UNIT 2 Lessons 7~12 School in Canada 18 It’s rainy today. Li Ming and Jenny go to school by bus. Li Ming: Do you always go to school by bus? Jenny: No, not always. Sometimes I ride my bike. Li Ming: Is your home near the school? Jenny: No, it’s far. So I never walk to school. How do you go to school, Li Ming? Li Ming: I often walk to school. 1 Li Ming and Jenny go to school Lesson 7 Here Comes the School Bus! Here’s the bus stop, Li Ming. Here comes the school bus! 1 2 3 MondayTuesdayWednesdayThursdayFriday Jenny often goes to school by bus. Sometimes she rides her bike. She never walks. Good morning, Ms. Scott. This is our bus driver, Ms. Scott. Good morning!

content: 19 Tick and write. always often sometimes never 1. I always have breakfast. 3. I ________ plant flowers. 5. ______________________ √ The rain is falling from the sky. The rain is wet, but I am dry. I have my boots, umbrella, too. I like a rainy day. Do you ? I see the bus stop where we meet. The school bus is coming down the street. The driver says, “Good morning! Hi! The rain is wet, but we are dry!” I always like a rainy day. I never go inside to play! And now the rain is gone and done. So goodbye rain and hello sun! 2. I ________ read books. 4. _______________________ 6. _______________________ • have breakfast • read books • plant flowers • help out at home • watch TV • do my homework 3 Let’s do it! 2 Let’s sing!

content: 20 1 Lesson 8 At Jenny’s School At school Li Ming: How many students are there in your school? Jenny: About 350 students. Li Ming: How many classes are there in Grade 5? Jenny: There are two. What about your school? Li Ming: There are six classes in Grade 5 in my school. Jenny: Many students in my school are from other countries. Li Ming: The students in my school are all Chinese. Everyone speaks Chinese. We also learn English. Jenny: In my school, we speak English, but we also learn French. Oh, time for math class. Let’s go! Your school is nice. Jenny and Li Ming get off the school bus. They walk to the school. Li Ming is very excited. Yes. But it’s not big.

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）五年级下册_c449cc6e
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）五年级下册_c449cc6e.pdf

content: 21 Welcome to Green Tree School. There are about 230 students in our school. In each class, there are about 20 students. Most students take the school bus to school. We go to school from Monday to Friday. School starts at 8:30 a.m. and ends at 3:30 p.m. We work hard. All the students have lunch at school. In the afternoon, we play basketball from 3:30 to 4:30. The school year begins in September and ends in June. Talk about your own school. What is the same? What is different? 2 Let’s do it! Green Tree School My School About 230 students. School starts at 8:30 a.m.

content: 22 Lesson 9 Li Ming Meets Jenny’s Class 1 In the new class 1 2 3 4 Mr. Wood, this is my friend Li Ming. Great! Where are you from ? How are you, Li Ming ? Fine, thanks! How are you ? Li Ming, this is my friend Sarah. She is from Australia. Nice to meet you, too, Mr. Wood! I’m from Shi j iazhuang. Hi Li Ming! Nice to meet you! I’m from China. What city are you from ? 23 Canada 1 2 3 4 Let’s play! 2 Many questions 3 Let’s do it! I’m from China. Where are you from ? Ask and answer. Hi Li Ming. I’m Peter. I’m from the U.S. No, we speak Chinese at home. I’m twelve, too. Hello Peter. How old are you, Li Ming ? I came on Monday. When did you come to Canada ? You speak good English! Does everyone in your family speak English ? Xi'an Gansu Where are you from ? I am from Canada. I am from Gansu. I’m twelve years old.

content: 26 Lesson 11 Always Do Your Homework! 1 Always or never? Mr. Wood: Class, let’s get to work. Li Ming, do you always do your homework? Li Ming: Yes! Mr. Wood: Good! Let’s put an A for always . Mr. Wood: Jenny, do you often help out at home? Jenny: Yes. I often clean the fl oor and wash the clothes. Mr. Wood: Let’s put an O for often . Mr. Wood: Steven, do you always walk to school? Steven: No. I sometimes walk to school. Sometimes I ride my bike. Mr. Wood: Let’s put an S for sometimes . Mr. Wood: Danny, do you wear dresses? Danny: No! I never wear dresses! Mr. Wood: Okay. Let’s put an N for never . Now it’s done! name do your homework help out at home walk to school wear dresses Li Ming Jenny Steven Danny always often sometimes never Look at the blackboard.

content: 28 1 2 Story time Lesson 12 Be Safe on the Way Today is the fi rst day of school. Some students meet at the bus stop. They wait for the school bus. They are very happy. It is always good to be careful. Everyone thinks so. They want to be safe while waiting for the bus. 3 4 Hi, my name is Sam. Hello, I’m Oba. I’m Neva. My name is Al. Where are you from ? I’m from this city. I’m always excited on the fi rst day of school. Me, too. I am always very careful. When I wait for the bus, I always watch for cars and bikes. And don’t play on the street. I often look to the left and to the right before I cross the street. Sometimes I take my friend’s hand. This will keep her safe.

content: 29 5 6 Do you know how to be safe on the street? Act out the story. Think and Act 7 8 Neva doesn’t like to talk. She never says much. Now, they see the yellow school bus coming. The driver is Ms. Marshall. She is very nice. The children sit on the bus. They talk and sing. The ﬁ rst day of school is always a happy day. Be careful, Neva. Don’t stand too close to the street. Thanks. Hello, boys and girls. Welcome back to school. Thank you! Please wear your seat belts. Okay! Always remember to be safe on the way. while 当 ……时 before 在……之前 cross 穿过，横过 seat belt 安全带 30 2 Look and write Unit 2 Review 1 Listen and match always never sometimes often 2. 1. 3. 4. content: 31 3 Read and write 2. What do you do on Sunday ? Please write. 1. Look and tick. My name is Ann. I’m from the U.S. I am a student in Grade 5. I don’t go to school on Saturday and Sunday. On Sunday, I often get up at eight o’clock and have breakfast at half past eight. Sometimes I go to the park and sometimes I go to the library in the morning. I always have a dance class in the afternoon. Then I walk home. I never get home late. What does Ann do on Sunday? 32 Speaking Reading Writing Listening At school At home Total stars I am... A 10 ~ 12 B 7 ~ 9 C 1 ~ 6 1 5 How am I doing? Words: driver Ms. science water blackboard clean always sometimes often but now Sentences: Where are you from? I’m from China. What’s the temperature inside? It’s twenty degrees. Do you always do your homework? I often/sometimes help out at home. Key words and sentences 4 33 UNIT 3 Lessons 13~18 We Love Sports

content: 33 UNIT 3 Lessons 13~18 We Love Sports 34 Lesson 13 Ping-pong and Basketball 1 Favourite sports basketball 2 1 ping-pong football In China, many people like to play ping-pong. Oh. In Canada, people like to play ice hockey. I play basketball and football. My favourite sport is basketball. What sports do you play, Li Ming ? I play football and ping-pong. Ping-pong is my favourite sport. 35 2 Let’s go to the store 3 Let’s do it! Look and talk. Li Ming: Can we play basketball after school, Jenny? Jenny: Sure. Can you teach me to play ping-pong? Li Ming: Yes. Do you have any ping-pong balls? Jenny: I don’t think so, but we can buy some ping-pong balls at the store. Li Ming: I want to buy a T-shirt, too. Let’s go to the store. Yes, I do. What sports do you play ? Do you have any ping-pong balls ? I play ping-pong.

content: 36 1 2 Lesson 14 At the Sports Store Here they are. Do you like this T-shirt or that one, Li Ming ? Excuse me! Do you have any T-shirts ? There’s a clerk. Let’s ask him for help. Yes! I’ll show you! And we need some ping-pong balls. Let’s see, Jenny. I need a T-shirt. 1 At the sports store 3 4 Thank you! 37 2 Let’s do it! — Do you like this football or that basketball? — I like that basketball. Look and write. That’s ten dollars for the T-shirt and four dollars for the ping-pong balls. Fourteen dollars, please. These balls are fi ve dollars. Those are four dollars. I want those! I like this one! Red is my favourite colour. Now we need some ping-pong balls. Do you have any ping-pong balls ? Sure! Do you want these or those ? 5 6 7 8 $ 14.00 ____________________________________ ____________________________________ ____________________________________ ____________________________________

content: 38 1 Playing basketball 1 2 3 4 5 6 Lesson 15 At the Gym Danny! Catch the ball! Ouch! Here I go! I’m throwing the basketball. Ouch! That ball is heavy! Throw the basketball at the net, Danny. This is too diffi cult. The ball is too heavy. There! This ball is light! I can throw it easily. Jenny, Danny and Li Ming went to the gym to play basketball and ping-pong. First, they played basketball. Then, Li Ming taught Jenny and Danny to play ping-pong. 39 2 Playing ping-pong Look and write. Do you know how to play ping-pong ? Let me show you! I am hitting the ball to Jenny. Can you hit the ball to Jenny ? I think I can! Ouch! I hit my hand! 1 2 3 4 3 Let’s do it! 1. The basketball is ________. The ping-pong ball is ________. 2. Jenny can fl y the kite very high. It’s ________ for her. Danny can’t fl y the kite. It’s ________ for him.

content: 40 1 Player, team and game Bob’s team is playing a basketball game. Lesson 16 A Basketball Game Jenny and Li Ming are going to watch Bob play basketball this evening. Who is Bob ? player team game Bob is Jenny’s brother. He is twenty years old. He is a policeman. On Saturday, he is a basketball player. He plays basketball for fun. He plays on a team. This is Bob’s team.

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）五年级下册_c449cc6e
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）五年级下册_c449cc6e.pdf

content: 41 Jenny and Li Ming arrive at the gym at 7:00 p.m. “There’s Bob’s team!” says Jenny. “Bob’s team has blue T-shirts and blue shorts.” “There’s the other team,” says Li Ming. “The other team has orange shorts and T-shirts.” Jenny and Li Ming have fun at the game. They jump up and down. “Go! Bob!” they shout. “Go! Blue team!” Now it’s 8:15 p.m. A player on the orange team has the ball. Look! He is throwing the ball. But Bob jumps up and catches it. Bob runs down the ﬂ oor. He puts the ball in the net! 2 At the game 3 Let’s do it! ● Who played at the game? ● Did Jenny and Li Ming have fun at the game? ● How many players are there on a basketball team? ● What sports do you play? ● Who’s your favourite player? Answer the questions. Great! Bob’s game is at the school gym. Let’s go.

content: 42 1 We watched a basketball game “Did Bob’s team play a game?” asks Mr. Smith. “Yes. Bob was on the blue team. His team played against the orange team,” says Jenny. “It was a good game. Everyone played hard!” “Did you have fun watching the game?” asks Mr. Smith. “Yes! We cheered for Bob’s team!” says Li Ming. Lesson 17 Who Won? We watched a basketball game. What did you do this evening, Jenny and Li Ming ? Go! Bob! Go! Blue team! “Who won?” asks Mr. Smith. “Bob’s team won!” says Li Ming. “That’s great!” says Mr. Smith.

What colour did this team wear? Orange. Blue. Did this team win? Yes, they did. No, they didn’t. Did this team play hard? Yes, they did. No, they didn’t. 3 Listen and repeat eat an egg in front of get up a map of China an orange look at put on at eight o’clock What game did you play ? Where did you play the game ? Which team won ?

metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）五年级下册_c449cc6e.pdf

content: 44 Many years ago, there was a boy from a very poor family. He liked to play football very much. But his family was too poor to buy him a football. So, the boy used boxes and bottles as his footballs. He played everywhere every day. At Christmas time, the boy wanted to do something for the kind coach. He ran to the coach’s home and dug a hole in the front yard. The coach asked why. The boy said, “I have no money to buy you a Christmas gift. But I can dig a hole Lesson 18 A Famous Football Player Story time One day, a coach saw him. He saw that the boy was a good player. The man gave the boy a football as a gift. From then on, the boy practised playing football harder than before. Soon he could kick the ball easily into the net.

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）五年级下册_c449cc6e
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）五年级下册_c449cc6e.pdf

content: 45 for your Christmas tree.” The coach was happy. He said, “Today I got the best gift in the world.” The coach asked the boy to be a player on his football team. In 1958, the 17-year-old boy and his team won the World Cup. He was famous around the country. Do you know who the boy is? He is Pele — the world famous football player! Think About It What Christmas gift did the boy give to his coach? How did the boy become a famous football player? coach 教练 practise 练习 kick 踢 dug 挖（dig的过去式） hole 洞；坑 yard 院子

How much do they need to pay? □ $ 30. □ $ 42. □ $ 50. 2 1 Look and write Listen and tick Unit 3 Review Last Sunday, I walked to the zoo. I ________ some bread for lunch. I ________ Li Ming to play basketball. I ________ the pandas. Li Ming ________ a T-shirt. We ________ to a store this morning. bought ate saw walked went taught

content: 47 3 4 Complete the dialogue Read and answer Peter: What did you do this afternoon? Tom: _____________ Peter: Oh. Did the green team play? Tom: _____________ Everyone played hard. Peter: Did you have fun? Tom: _____________ Peter: That’s great. A. Yes, I had fun. I cheered for the green team. B. Yes, the green team played against the yellow team. C. I watched a ping-pong game. a. What’s Guo Yang’s favourite sport ? b. How many players are there on each team ? c. Who is Guo Yang’s favourite basketball player ? My Favourite Sport Hello! I’m Guo Yang. I like sports very much. I like running and playing basketball. Basketball is my favourite sport. I often play basketball with my friends. We have two teams — the Tiger Team and the Lion Team. Each team has fi ve players. Steven and I are on the Tiger Team. Li Lin is on the Lion Team. We have fun together. My favourite basketball player is Yao Ming. I want to be a basketball player like him.

content: 49 UNIT 4 Lessons 19~24 Good Habits 50 1 More vegetables Lesson 19 Eat More Vegetables and Fruit How often does Danny eat…? day week year vegetables — 2 104 fruit — 3 156 donuts 2 14 730 I think I need to eat more vegetables and fruit. Danny, how often do you eat vegetables ? An apple a day keeps the doctor away! How often do you eat fruit ? Three times a week! How often do you eat donuts ? Twice a day! After lunch and after dinner. Danny, you need to eat more vegetables and fruit. They’re good for you! I eat potatoes and tomatoes twice a week. 1 3 2 4 51 Talk and write. How often do you eat/drink...? vegetables fruit meat milk ... Me My friend ... noodles juice bread potato egg ice cream orange cake apple chicken rice tomato 2 Let’s do it! What do you like to eat ? What’s your favourite vegetable ? How often do you eat vegetables ?

content: 52 1 2 Before and after Strong and healthy teeth Lesson 20 Always Brush Your Teeth! 1 2 3 Before breakfast, I wash my hands and brush my teeth. I have breakfast at 7:00 every morning. After breakfast, I go to school. Jenny always has breakfast. Before breakfast, she washes her face and brushes her teeth. After breakfast, she goes to school. What do you do before breakfast ? I brush my teeth. How often do you brush your teeth ? Three times a day. I want strong and healthy teeth.

content: 53 2. Think and talk. Do you want to get holes in your teeth ? No! I don’t want that. 3 Let’s do it! I always do my homework before dinner. After dinner, I wash the dishes. My mom always tells me to ________________ in the morning and before bed. “Why?” I asked her one day. She said, “It makes your teeth ________________.” “If I don’t brush my teeth, what will ________________?” I asked. Mom said, “If you don’t brush your teeth, you may get holes in them. Then your teeth will ________________.” 1. Read and write. happen brush my teeth hurt strong and healthy What do you do before and after breakfast/lunch/dinner? What do you do before and after dinner ?

content: 54 1 What is exercise? 2 What do you do for exercise? Exercise helps make your body healthy and strong. Riding a bike is exercise. Walking is exercise. Running is exercise. Playing sports is exercise. How much exercise do you need? You need about an hour of exercise every day. 1 1 3 2 4 Lesson 21 Exercise! Let’s see... I walk to school in the morning and I walk home after school. What do you do for exercise, Danny ? Sixty minutes make an hour!

content: 55 4 Everyone, everyone, Reach up high! Everyone, everyone, Touch the sky! Everyone, everyone, Turn around! Everyone, everyone, Touch the ground! Everyone, everyone, Bend down low. Everyone, everyone, Touch your toes. 3 Let’s chant! 2 3 That’s thirty minutes of exercise a day. No, Danny! You need to play sports for exercise! That’s twice a day. How many minutes do you walk ? About fi fteen minutes. All right. I’m going to watch more sports on TV! What do you think of my exercise, Mr. Wood ? I think you need to get more exercise, Danny!

content: 56 1 What are good habits? Lesson 22 Go to Bed Early! Today we are going to talk about good habits. First, please answer my question. What are good habits, class ? Doing exercise is a good habit. That’s right. Yes. These are all good habits. Helping others is a good habit, too. I think… Going to bed early is a good habit. I’m glad to hear that. Having breakfast every day is a good habit. 1 3 2 4 Eating healthy food is a good habit. 57 Dear Mom and Dad, Today was a great day at school. We talked about good habits. Going to bed early, always having breakfast and spending time with family are all good habits. I can‛t be with you right now, but I‛m always thinking about you. Love, Li Ming Subject: Good habits! To: lidaming@163.com From: liming@hotmail.com 2 Li Ming’s email I always keep clean. That’s good. 5 6 You’re right, Li Ming. 3 Let’s do it! Talk and write. My bad habits My good habits Listening to my parents is a good habit.

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）五年级下册_c449cc6e
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）五年级下册_c449cc6e.pdf

content: 58 Lesson 23 I Can’t Tell a Lie When George was six years old, his father gave him an axe. George liked his new axe very much. He tried it on many things. One day, little George cut down a small tree behind their house. In the evening, his father came home and saw the poor tree. He was very angry. He asked loudly, “What happened to my favourite cherry tree?” George was very afraid. He cried, “I’m sorry. I cut down your cherry tree, Father! I can’t tell a lie.” George’s father looked at him. He smiled, “I’m happy you told the truth, my son! Being honest is more important than one hundred cherry trees.” 1 George and the cherry tree

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）五年级下册_c449cc6e
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）五年级下册_c449cc6e.pdf

content: 59 3 Listen and repeat sit in a chair read a book send an email come for a visit I like it very much. How old are you? 2 Let’s do it! 1. Read and tick. 2. Talk about the story. a. How old was George in this story? Eight years old. Six years old. b. What did his father give him? An axe. A tree. c. What was his father’s favourite thing near their house? A cherry tree. An axe. d. What did George do when his father asked him about the tree? He told the truth. He told a lie. We’ll feel bad for a long time. It’s good to tell the truth. What can we learn from the story ? Why shouldn’t we lie ?

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）五年级下册_c449cc6e
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）五年级下册_c449cc6e.pdf

content: 60 Her parents loved her very much, but did not know how to talk to her. She couldn’t see anything. She couldn’t hear anything. She couldn’t speak at all. When she was 7 years old, her parents met a teacher, Anne Sullivan. Anne became Helen’s friend. She wanted to teach Helen words. But it was very hard. Lesson 24 Helen Keller Helen often got angry. Sometimes, she threw her food from the table. Oh no! 1 2 3 4 Story time Helen Keller was born in the United States in 1880. When she was 19 months old, she fell ill and became deaf and blind.

metadata.filename: 义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）五年级下册_c449cc6e
metadata.source: /Users/LeoQin/Documents/GitHub/PDFconvertor/flattened_pdfs/义务教育教科书·英语（一年级起点）五年级下册_c449cc6e.pdf

content: 61 From that day on, Helen Keller began her studies. She worked very, very hard. She learned many new words every day. One day, Anne took Helen’s hand and let her feel the water. She wrote the word “water” on Helen’s hand. One of her famous books is The Story of My Life . Helen’s story inspires many people around the world. She learned to speak, read and write. When she was 20 years old, she went to university. Later, she became a great writer. 5 6 7 8 What can you learn from Helen Keller? What do you think of Helen’s teacher? Think About It born 出生 deaf 聋的 blind 失明的 university 大学 writer 作家 inspire 激励

content: 63 3 Talk and write 4 Read and write clean the house about 10 minutes wash the clothes read books play sports do homework Healthy or Not? Mr. Black always gets up late in the morning. He never has breakfast. After he gets up, he sits in a chair and watches TV for about two hours. Next, he eats fast food for lunch. Then, he plays computer games in the afternoon. In the evening, he drives to buy some ice cream and cake for dinner. He never goes to bed before 2:00 in the morning. Is he a healthy man ? a. __________ he gets up, he watches TV. b. __________ he has lunch, he plays computer games. c. __________ dinner, he drives to buy some ice cream and cake. d. __________ 2:00 a.m., he goes to bed. before after How many minutes a day do you clean the house ? About 10 minutes.

content: 65 Unit 1 airport 机场 （１） learn 学，学习 （１） clock 钟，时钟 （１） half 一半；半 （１） past 晚于；过 （１） him 他 （ he 的宾格形式） （１） around 到处，四处；周围 （２） living room 客厅 （２） kitchen 厨房 （２） bathroom 浴室 （２） floor 楼层；地板 （２） toilet 马桶；厕所 （２） bedroom 卧室 （２） study 书房；学习 （２） breakfast 早餐 （３） milk 牛奶 （３） fridge 冰箱 （３） them 他们 （ they 的宾格形式） （３） dinner 晚餐 （４） vegetable 蔬菜 （４） carrot 胡萝卜 （４） dirty 脏的 （４） dry 擦干；干的 （４） watch 观看 （５） newspaper 报纸 （５） Unit 2 driver 司机 （７） Ms. 女士 （７） Scott 斯科特（姓氏） （７） always 一直；总是 （７） sometimes 有时 （７） ride 骑；乘 （７） never 从不，从未；决不 （７） often 时常；经常 （７） Word List （注：黑体词为要求听懂、会说、认读和书写的词汇）
